data.title: Carroll County Arkansas Genealogy, History, maps with Berryville, Eureka Springs, Green Forest, Oak Grove, Civil War, AR, Goodspeed, Goodspeed's, Goodspeeds, biographies, biography, family, families
data.meta_description:
An informative and historical overview of Carroll County, Arkansas with more than 125 pages including 82 
biographies plus 30 different Carroll County communities on 4 different maps. Includes history and genealogy for the cities of Eureka Springs, 
Berryville, Carrollton, Green Forest, Fairview, Winona Springs, Beaver, Gaskin, AR, ARK, Civil War, map, 
Goodspeed, Goodspeed's, Goodspeeds, biographies, biography, family, families

Carroll County, Arkansas History and Genealogy

Over 125 pages of Carroll County, Arkansas history and genealogy including 82 biographies plus 4 different historical maps featuring the locations of more than 30 Carroll County, Arkansas communities

An informative and historical overview of Carroll County, Arkansas including two separate sections on one CD which include 4 historical maps (1855, 1895, 1898, and 1915); plus the full 1889 Goodspeed's "History of Carroll County, Arkansas" book including 82 biographies. An important resource for the study and research of Carroll County, Arkansas history and genealogy.

Fully searchable - find any name or location instantly!

This fascinating and detailed CD contains ALL of the following material in two separate sections, ALL on one CD:

Section One of two, all on one CD: Maps of Carroll County, Arkansas

Included here are the North Western region of Arkansas sections of 4 different historical maps:

A. A rare 1855 map that shows the area of Carroll County, Arkansas just twenty two years after Carroll County was formed. Communities shown are: Berryville * Carrollton * Crooked Creek * Kings River * Mt. Pleasant * Osage

B. A map of 1895 Carroll County, Arkansas showing the locations of 19 different settlements including all of the following: Alpena * Beaver * Berryville * Carrollton * Colin * Dry Fork * Eureka Springs * Freeman * Gaskins * Glen * Green Forest * Maple * Oak Grove * Omega * Osage * Polo * Rudd * Rule * Winona Springs *

C. A map of 1898 Carroll County, Arkansas showing the locations of 23 different settlements including all of the following: Beaver * Berryville * Carrollton * Coin * Denver * Dry Fork * Eureka Springs * Gaskins * Glen * Hugh * Maple * Mundell * Oakgrove * Oakhill (or The Narrows) * Olivet * Omega * Osage * Polo * Raum * Rudd * Rule * Winona Springs * Yocum *

D. A map of 1915 Carroll County, Arkansas showing the locations of 21 different settlements including all of the following: Beaver * Berryville * Busch * Cabanal * Carrollton * Cisco * Delmar * Denver * Dryfork * Elk Ranch * Eureka Springs * Green Forest * High * Mundell * Oakgrove * Oakhill * Osage * Raum * Rudd * Rule * Yocum *

View a map of 1889 Carroll County, Arkansas: Carroll County Arkansas 1889 Map

Section Two of two, all on one CD: The complete 1889 "History of Carroll County, Arkansas" by the Goodspeed Publishing Co.

This detailed (over 125 pages in all) book has an incredible amount of historical and genealogical information about Carroll County, Arkansas from its earliest settlement up to 1889. This is an exact photo replica of all the pages pertaining to Carroll County, Arkansas including all of the historical and biographical information. Included are a total of 82 different Carroll County, Arkansas family biographies.

Here is just some of the information included:

Carroll County Topography-Geology-Resources

Caves in Carroll County, Arkansas

Settlement and Development of Carroll County, Arkansas

Indian Occupation in Carroll County, Arkansas

Early Settlers of Carroll County, Arkansas

Early Mills in Carroll County, Arkansas

Carroll County Roads

Carroll County Tanneries

Carroll County Stores

Regulators in Carroll County, Arkansas

Early Land Entries Carroll County, Arkansas

Carroll County Population

The Mountain Meadows Massacre connection to Carroll County, Arkansas

Carroll County Organization

Carroll County Officers

Carroll County Buildings

Removal of the Carroll County Seat

Carroll County Jails

Carroll County Township Organization

Carroll County Courts

Carroll County, Arkansas Towns and Villages: Eureka Springs * Berryville * Carrollton * Green Forest * Other Villages * Fairview * Winonia Springs * Beaver * Gaskins

The Military Record of Carroll County, Arkansas

Mexican War

The Civil War in Carroll County, Arkansas

Home Guards

Confederate Troops from Carroll County, Arkansas

Federal Troops from Carroll County, Arkansas

Operations in Carroll County

Carroll County Churches

Carroll County Schools

Biographical Appendix

Included is a total of 82 Carroll County, Arkansas family biographies (valuable for genealogy) including each of the following surnames:

(Hundreds of other surnames are also mentioned throughout the text and within these biographies): Adams * Beatty * Beaver * Bobo * Bradley * Breeding * Brown * Bunch * Carroll * Champlin * Chaney * Clayton * Collier * Davis * Denton * Ducker * Fancher * Fraker * Freeman * Fry * Gaskins * George * Glitsch * Gray * Hailey * Hamilton * Harbert * Hardesty * Hill * Hodge * Hulsey * Hurd * Johnston * Jones * Jordan * Kirkham * Lee * Martin * Mitchell * Molloy * Morris * Neff * Nicholes * Nunnally * Pearce * Perry * Phillips * Pickard * Plumlee * Powell * Poynor * Ramsey * Ray * Reese * Russell * Seitz * Shahan * Smith * Sneed * Sweesy * Temple * Tobein * Vincent * Watkins * Webb * Weymouth * Woodruff * Worthington * Young *

Carroll County, Arkansas is located in the Northwest corner of Arkansas and is bordered by the following counties: Barry County, Missouri * Stone County, Missouri * Boone County, Arkansas * Newton County, Arkansas * Madison County, Arkansas * and Benton County, Arkansas (highlighted county names can be clicked on for further description)

Each of the two sections on this CD is in Adobe Acrobat pdf format and requires the free Acrobat Reader program to view. You probably already have this program on your computer but if not, a free copy of the program is included on the CD. Each of the books is designed to look just like a regular book and is bookmarked to move easily and quickly from one section another. This CD was designed by, and is available exclusively from Hearthstone Legacy Publications.

Fully searchable - find any name or location instantly!

The cost for this CD containing both sections described above is only $9.95 plus shipping, or only $4.95 as a digital download! A large amount of history and genealogy information for very little cost! A truly fascinating view of Carroll County, Arkansas from its first settlement to 1889.
